*div1 type="summary"* *p*John S. Wills to Austin, Brown County, Ohio, March 22, 1825. Inquiries about opportunities for professional men. Rumors of assimilation of Mexico by the United States.*/p* */div1*
*div1 type="body"*
*p**location_mentioned*State of Ohio*/location_mentioned* *location_mentioned*Brown County*/location_mentioned* *location_mentioned*Ripley*/location_mentioned* *date_mentioned n="03-22-1825">March 22, 1825*/date_mentioned**/p* *p*Sir*/p*
*p*By *person_mentioned*Mr. Wm Cummings*/person_mentioned* I take the liberty of addressing you, tho: a perfect *person_mentioned*stranger*/person_mentioned*, this however I hope will not be considered intrusive, in as much as I am very desirous of leming the general character of your *location_mentioned*province*/location_mentioned*, as to general Laws and municipal regulations by profession I am a *person_mentioned*lawyer*/person_mentioned*, and have been in the profession for upwards of twenty five years, and have connected with me a *person_mentioned*Son in Law*/person_mentioned* of the same profession, a young man of finished education, and in general opinion of much promise. I have also *person_mentioned*Nephew*/person_mentioned* a *person_mentioned*phisician*/person_mentioned*, regularly bread, these *person_mentioned*gentlemen*/person_mentioned* have strong inclination to settle in some New *location_mentioned*Country*/location_mentioned*, opening to them, prospects, more flattering to their views, than any thing in this section of the *location_mentioned*United States*/location_mentioned*. By *location_mentioned*News paper */location_mentioned*information we here are informed, that the Government of *location_mentioned*Mexeco*/location_mentioned*, will be partially organized and assimelated to the Government of these *location_mentioned*United States*/location_mentioned* so far as circumstances will permit, should your government, be organized with a Judiciary likened to that of any [of] our states it is presumable some field would be opened for a young [man] of legal acquirements, of which you will be pleased to inform me.*/p*
*p*It is not improbable but that upon satisfactory information, of the character of your government, should it be as I have had reason to calculate, I would with some few others become *person_mentioned*citizens*/person_mentioned* thereof, for myself I could not from age (fifty) expect much, but my object is the promotion of my *person_mentioned*connections*/person_mentioned*, we could not bring much wealth, with us, but I can say with some confidence, we could, bring that, that would be no loss to your *location_mentioned*infant establishment*/location_mentioned*, character etc.*/p*
*p*At some leisure moment, will you be pleased to devote, a little time in answering this letter, and have it, forwarded to some post office in the*location_mentioned* United States*/location_mentioned*,*/p*
*p**person_mentioned*John S. Wills.*/person_mentioned**/p* *p*NB I believe I knew your*person_mentioned* father*/person_mentioned*, when he resided in *location_mentioned*Richmond, Virginia*/location_mentioned* I was then studying Law in that place, I saw him afterwards at *location_mentioned*Cincennati Ohio*/location_mentioned*, on his way to the *location_mentioned*lower Country*/location_mentioned**/p*
*p**person_mentioned*J. S. W*/person_mentioned*.*/p**p* *person_mentioned*Colo. Philip Austin*/person_mentioned* *location_mentioned*New Mexico*/location_mentioned*.*/p* */div1*
